caption:
April 24, 2013, marked the Rana Plaza factory collapse in Bangladesh, a tragedy that left over a thousand garment workers dead, highlighting the unsafe work conditions and obscurity of most supply chains in the industry.  

At Kotn, we believe that traceability—the knowledge of where a product came from, who made it, and when—shouldn’t be a luxury, but a standard. It’s why we work with our partners directly, ensuring living wages and safe working conditions at every step of our supply chain. 

So today, in honour of Fashion Revolution Day, we want you to meet some of our makers. Explore our stories to meet the people behind the fibre, fabric, and seams of Kotn!
comments: [{'text': 'Love the level of accountability ❤️', 'length': 35}, {'text': 'a beautiful ethos!', 'length': 18}, {'text': '🤍🤍🤍', 'length': 3}]

caption:
An ancient practice, the art of natural dyeing makes the most of the resources already at our, and in our, disposal. Artist and Natural Dyer @caramariepiazza recycles food and floral waste to create her dye matter and transform pre-existing pieces, limiting household and closet waste. 

We asked Cara to walk us through one of her favourites techniques—ice dyeing—as a part of our Sustainability Series. Explore our stories to see how she does it!

caption:
Sustainability today often comes with a price tag. But for past generations, and still in many communities around the world, ‘sustainability’ exists as an everyday practice of treating our resources with care. So this Earth Day, we asked our community for their traditions and tricks—self-taught and inherited—to live sustainably day-to-day.
Explore the feature in our stories and at kotn.com. Plus, be on the lookout for a week’s worth of takeovers to bring these tricks to life.

caption:
After 20th century painter Paul Klee’s voyage to Tunisia in 1914, which inspired some of his greatest colour work, he shifted his focus to Egypt. Studying the movement of the sun, he noticed how its light transformed the landscape’s mud-based buildings. 

The colours of those transformations inspired his artwork, which in turn, inspired the colour palette of our Linen Bedding collection. Rich, saturated shades inspired by the brilliance of the Egyptian sun blending with the landscape.

caption:
We have a plastic problem and it’s invaded our wardrobes. The prevalence of synthetic fabrics in clothing—like polyester, spandex and acrylic—is causing millions of microplastic fibres to leech into our waterways with every laundry cycle. 

That’s why we focus on nature’s finest: super-soft, plastic-free, naturally breathable fibres that can biodegrade at the end of their lifecycle. 

Explore our stories to learn more and take action with your own synthetic pieces.

caption:
PANTONE 17-1444 TCX: Ginger

A flowering plant from the same family as turmeric and cardamon, known for its flavourful and aromatic root. Warm, spicy, and a little sweet—the root is used as a pungent spice and a soothing traditional medicine. 

Meet our version of Ginger, ready to infuse a little warmth into your wardrobe. Available now!

caption:
Pantone 18-0820 TCX: Capers

Native to the Mediterranean coast, the caper plant features round, fleshy leaves and large white flowers, born from its famous edible buds. Those dark olive buds are usually salted or pickled and used as a flavourful garnish in Mediterranean cuisine. 

Meet our version of caper, fully bloomed in our Lounge collection. Available now!
